sentence.Network_en: We have a rare old time at the party.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们在聚会中尽情欢乐.

sentence.Network_en: I had a fine old time.
The effect of that singing, as the old-time reporters used to say, was electrical.
sentence.Network_cn: 正如从前的记者常说的那样，歌声直击人心。

entry.def: If you describe something as old-time, you mean that it was common or popular in the past but is not common or popular now.

example.ex: ...an old-time dance hall which still has a tea dance on Monday afternoons.
example.tran: 每周一下午依旧举办茶话舞会的老式舞厅

entry.tran: （用于职业名称前）过去的，昔日的
entry.def: You can use old-time before the name of someone's job to show that they do their job in the way it was done in the past.

example.ex: The effect of that singing, as the old-time reporters used to say, was electrical.
example.tran: 正如从前的记者常说的那样，歌声直击人心。

example.ex: ...like an old-time sailor climbing the rigging.

sentences.sentence: "a vaulted roof supporting old-time chimney pots"
